intro: Barbarea orthoceras, commonly known as the broadleaf winter cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of rounded, lobed leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Barbarea orthoceras is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
